verses.text: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: But the righteous are bold as a lion.
For the transgression of a land many \add are\add* the princes thereof: But by a man of understanding \add and\add* knowledge the state \add thereof\add* shall be prolonged.
A poor man that oppresseth the poor \add Is like\add* a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
They that forsake the law praise the wicked: But such as keep the law contend with them.
Evil men understand not judgment: But they that seek the \sc Lord\sc* understand all \add things\add*.
Better \add is\add* the poor that walketh in his uprightness, Than \add he that is\add* perverse in \add his\add* ways, though he \add be\add* rich.
Whoso keepeth the law \add is\add* a wise son: But he that is a companion of riotous \add men\add* shameth his father.
He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, He shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, Even his prayer \add shall be\add* abomination.
Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, He shall fall himself into his own pit: But the upright shall have good \add things\add* in possession.
The rich man \add is\add* wise in his own conceit; But the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
When righteous \add men\add* do rejoice, \add there is\add* great glory: But when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.
He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: But whoso confesseth and forsaketh \add them\add* shall have mercy.
Happy \add is\add* the man that feareth alway: But he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
\add As\add* a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; \add So is\add* a wicked ruler over the poor people.
The prince that wanteth understanding \add is\add* also a great oppressor: \add But\add* he that hateth covetousness shall prolong \add his\add* days.
A man that doeth violence to the blood of \add any\add* person Shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: But \add he that is\add* perverse in \add his\add* ways shall fall at once.
He that tilleth his land shall have plenty \add of\add* bread: But he that followeth after vain \add persons\add* shall have poverty enough.
A faithful man shall abound with blessings: But he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
To have respect of persons \add is\add* not good: For for a piece of bread \add that\add* man will transgress.
He that hasteth to be rich \add hath\add* an evil eye, And considereth not that poverty shall come \add upon\add* him.
He that rebuketh a man, afterwards shall find more favour Than he that flattereth with the tongue.
Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, And saith, \add It is\add* no transgression; The same \add is\add* the companion of a destroyer.
He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: But he that putteth his trust in the \sc Lord\sc* shall be made fat.
He that trusteth in his own heart \add is\add* a fool: But whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
He that giveth unto the poor \add shall\add* not lack: But he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: But when they perish, the righteous increase.
